channel.title: amnesia: the dark descente
channel.description: Preordered this cuz Penumbra Ruled and i play my cash quick and wild. anyone else getting this because they are cool and like fun games? or maybe you want to explain how you are ugly and cowardly and you live in a wind tunnel but the wind is farts so you are not going to buy or pirate and play amnesia: the dark decent.

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Java-O-To!:

Have the game. Should i play it while I’m high?

Yes, that way a zombie will seem to come out of the screen at you and you will stab yourself before it gets to you. Then you won’t have to post any more stupid questions.

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
Katana:

I could be wrong, but I think the monster/light dillema is solved by hiding in environmental lights. The lantern makes the monsters notice you, but torches on the wall don’t quite as much. I could be wrong. The game is also trying to convince you to hide in a place that is completely outside line-of-sight from a monster

I don’t give them any points for this, since hiding in environmental light as opposed to lantern light isn’t a logical conclusion anyone playing should come to.

I’ll pass the prison eventually, I just don’t feel like sneaking around. I don’t find the stealth aspect of Amnesia or the Penumbra games to be nearly as exciting as the more clever enemy encounters or puzzle exploration.

Read full topic

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
lambda:

Hmmm, i’m in the refinery(hehe, not that far…), but what’s up with the water?

Want to know what creeps under there, makes those ghastly noises, and will chase you to the end no matter what?

So do we.
(fear of the unknown)

Read full topic

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
DinoThrasher:
  1. Combination of sanity meter and bad-guys. I’m having trouble moving around, specifically in the prison, when I have to worry about both of these at the same time. I can’t stay out the dark because the enemies will spot me, but I can’t stay out of the light because then I’ll go insane.

I could be wrong, but I think the monster/light dillema is solved by hiding in environmental lights. The lantern makes the monsters notice you, but torches on the wall don’t quite as much. I could be wrong. The game is also trying to convince you to hide in a place that is completely outside line-of-sight from a monster

Also: My character went insane for a short while. Some weird things can happen, like insects crawling across your screen. Also, didn’t get chased, but I think if a monster chases you while you’re insane, you’re likely to trip, the monster will move faster, and you will make a lot of noise that makes you easy to follow.

Read full topic

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Demo scared the shit out of me, got the game yesterday, yet to try it though. I hope it’s as scary as the demo and the story is good. Haven’t played a game that’s actually scared me like the demo probably, ever. Scary FPS games + guns aren’t scary at all.

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
I’m enjoying the game so far, but have 2 major complaints:

  1. Combination of sanity meter and bad-guys. I’m having trouble moving around, specifically in the prison, when I have to worry about both of these at the same time. I can’t stay out the dark because the enemies will spot me, but I can’t stay out of the light because then I’ll go insane.

  2. Weaker characterization than Penumbra. I don’t know, but I felt like Phillip was a much more characterized person. The beginning backstory and then some monolouges during the loading screen helped me picture Phillip as a person. David, on the other hand, just has his journals. This more makes me feel like David is no longer here, and I’m the one going through the castle… which is of course not true.

In summary: I like the atmosphere, environment, and overall design of Amnesia better, but David’s a total pussy who’s afraid of the dark and can’t compare to Phillip who just didn’t know when to quit and was overall a more well-rounded character.

Read full topic

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: Charchar
item.description:
The whole game is about it’s own story, just like Penumbra

These games are a great experience, I’ve been playing this one, but I only play them during the night and with headphones, just to help the atmosphere of the game

item.title: amnesia: the dark descente
item.dc:creator: Wombat
item.description:
Katana:

I’ll keep trying with it, but I was kinda annoyed that they insisted “let the atmosphere envelope you” (feel free to explore!) and yet you get this time-rush thing from staying in the darkness too long, and how you HAVE to progress further to stop the camera from shaking with shader effects.

I kind of agree but it also can make the gameplay more intense when you just have to move on instead of hiding in a corner for ten minutes (did it a lot in penumbras ). Nothing can’t be said for sure though before I have played the full game.

Read full topic
